page.title: 09BUILDINGS IN KING'S STANLEY
page.content: The houses in the village are built mainly of limestone but there are some brick houses.The oldest building, apart from the church,is probably Tudor Stores which is a timber frame building with lath & plaster infilling.The new houses on the small outlying estates are mainly of brick although there is some use of imitation limestone blocks.The school was built in Victorian times though some prefabricated classrooms have been erected during the last 20 years. The Church is Norman,having a single aisle on the South side of the nave and a tower at the West end.Much restoration was carried out in Victorian times; the church was completely rebuilt.
